answers.answer: It honestly depends everyone is different. They will induce you sooner if they think baby is at risk etc I was induced at 40weeks with gestational diabetes so.if you need to.talk feel free to send me a message

Thank u I may well do. I've been trying not to think about labour cos I assumed it would be 4-6 weeks away and ideally wanted to try a water birth.  Guess I'm just waiting for this to sink in ps does being induced make labour more difficult?

I'm from the U.S but I had that with my son and was admitted to the hospital at 38 weeks and induced. I was told i had preeclampsia. My while body was also swollen(never had a problem till that morning I woke up). It was safer for me to have him right away then wait.

question: I'm 36+1 and in the UK. Today my go checked me as my midwife is on holiday. Due to swollen hands, trace of protein in urine and high resting bp - 102 I'm being referred to a consultant to discuss inducement. Do they mean this will happen around my due date 19th Aug, or are they likely to consider doing it sooner? Thank u in advance
title: High Blood Pressure & Protein
